column4: having trouble booting up all of a sudden.  I get the Grub menu with 4 options:  a) ubuntu xxx-generic  b) ubuntu xxx-generic (recovery mode)  c &d memory test.    When i select a)  i get a black (dos) like screen with BusyBox v1.17.1.   Any help greatly appreciated...i've been working on turning in my final exam project tomorrow.
what's the menu entry for the first option?
actually, it might be better if you pastebin it...
what do you mean menu entry?
if you absolutely need to get stuff done quick, I recommend live USB booting ;)
there's an option for 'editing' the grub option.    it shows something like ... set root='(/dev/sda,msdos1)
and I should really freaking take a shower.. in fact, I don't even know why I'm in here.
please to take a shower yet =D
i have no idea why it says msdos..... this was a pure msdos box.
hm, that's odd. perhaps it's the partiion table type.
that's possible...as i had formatted a ms partition in the past
naw, it's usually an msdos partition table anyway... LOL
anyway... what do you mean by a busybox?
